docs.title: Welcome to Dogpedia 🐶
docs.text:
This documentation is your friendly guide to everything dogs.

Whether you're a new owner or a dog enthusiast, this site covers:

  • Popular breeds and their characteristics
  • Proper care and nutrition
  • Training tips and techniques

docs.title: Why Dogs Are Amazing
docs.text:
Dogs are more than pets—they are companions, helpers, and loyal friends. They have unique personalities, instincts, and abilities.

Note

Remember: every dog is different. What works for one breed may not work for another.

docs.title: Explore the Site
docs.text:
Use the left-hand navigation to browse:

  1. Breeds – Learn about popular dog breeds and their traits.
  2. Care – Nutrition, grooming, and health tips.
  3. Training – Effective ways to teach your dog good behavior.

docs.title: Popular Dog Breeds
docs.text: Dogs come in many shapes and sizes. Here are some of the most beloved breeds:

docs.title: Labrador Retriever
docs.text:
• Friendly, intelligent, and outgoing
  • Excellent family dogs and therapy dogs
  • Weight: 55–80 lbs
  • Lifespan: 10–12 years

docs.title: German Shepherd
docs.text:
• Loyal, courageous, and versatile
  • Frequently used in police and service work
  • Weight: 50–90 lbs
  • Lifespan: 9–13 years

docs.title: Golden Retriever
docs.text:
• Intelligent, friendly, and devoted
  • Great with children and other pets
  • Weight: 55–75 lbs
  • Lifespan: 10–12 years

docs.title: Choosing the Right Breed
docs.text:
• Consider your living situation: apartment vs house
  • Evaluate activity level
  • Consider allergies and grooming needs
  • Think about temperament with children and other pets

docs.title: Dog Care Guide
docs.text: Proper care ensures a healthy, happy dog.

docs.title: Nutrition
docs.text:
• Feed a balanced diet according to breed, age, and activity.
  • Fresh water should always be available.
  • Avoid toxic foods:
  • Chocolate
  • Grapes and raisins
  • Onions and garlic

docs.title: Grooming
docs.text:
• Regular brushing prevents matting and shedding.
  • Nail trimming every 3–4 weeks.
  • Bathing only when necessary to preserve natural oils.

docs.title: Health
docs.text:
• Schedule annual vet visits.
  • Vaccinations and parasite prevention.
  • Watch for signs of illness:
  • Loss of appetite
  • Lethargy
  • Unusual behavior

docs.title: Dog Training Basics
docs.text: Training strengthens the bond between you and your dog. Consistency and patience are key.

docs.title: Positive Reinforcement
docs.text:
• Reward good behavior immediately.
  • Use treats, praise, or play.
  • Avoid punishment.

Example: Owner: "Sit!" Dog sits Owner: Gives treat + verbal praise

docs.title: House Training
docs.text:
• Take your dog outside frequently.
  • Praise immediately after elimination.
  • Establish a routine.

Warning

Puppies have small bladders. Expect accidents at first — patience is essential.
